critique: The executive order seems to want to convey joy and surprise. The order discusses the appointment of David H. Morton as personal secretary and law clerk in the United States Customs Court, New York, without reference to the requirements of the civil service rules. This action is desired by Judge Brown of the court. This may convey joy and surprise to Judge Brown and David H. Morton. However, the order does not seem to want to convey sadness, anger, fear, or disgust.
